titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Amil Gargano papers, 1960-2011 and undated RL.11364
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-03-24 16:38:04 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

did.abstract: Advertising executive with several prominent agencies including Carl Ally, Inc. and Ally & Gargano, in both Detroit and New York. Includes correspondence, corporate reports and policy manuals, pamphlets and other printed material, proofs and tearsheet print advertisements, storyboards and sketches, videocassettes, 16mm and 35mm film reels, optical media (CDs and DVDs), memorabilia and other materials that document Gargano's career in advertising, film direction, education and consulting. Companies represented include Ally & Gargano, Carl Ally, Amil Gargano & Partners, Alabama Power, Audiovox, Burger King, Calvin Klein, Dunkin' Donuts, Federal Express, Fiat, Hertz, Horn & Hardart, IBM, Pentax, Piper Aircraft, Saab, SAS, Shearson Lehman, Sight Savers, Smithsonian Institution National Museum of American History, Syracuse University and Volvo. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into seven series: General and Personal Files; Ally & Gargano; Amil Gargano & Partners; Carly Ally, Inc.; Slides; Print Advertisements; and Audiovisual Materials.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Born, Detroit, 1932; Military 1952-1954; Cranbrook Academy of Art 1954; Campbell-Ewald Detroit 1955 (Group Art Director 1957); Campbell-Ewald New York 1959; Co-founder and Chief Creative Officer, Carl Ally, Inc. 1962 (Change to Ally & Gargano 1977); Visiting Professor, Syracuse University, 1973-1998; CEO, Ally & Gargano 1978 (Chairman 1983); Art Directors Hall of Fame 1982; One Club Creative Hall of Fame 1984; Board, Smithsonian Institution Center for Advertising History, 1988; film documentary for SightSavers 1990; Board, Helen Keller International 1990; founder, Amil Gargano & Partners 1992 (agency closed 2001); published book on Ally & Gargano 2010.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Amil Gargano papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2016.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Amil Gargano papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2016-0221

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections:

Arthur Einstein papers; Bates Worldwide, Inc. records; J. Walter Thompson Company Account Files; J. Walter Thompson Company Advertising Vertical Files; J. Walter Thompson Company Competitive Advertisements; J. Walter Thompson Company Domestic Advertisements

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, corporate reports and policy manuals, pamphlets and other printed material, proofs and tearsheet print advertisements, storyboards and sketches, videocassettes, 16mm and 35mm film reels, optical media (CDs and DVDs), memorabilia and other materials that document Gargano's career in advertising, film direction, education and consulting. Companies represented include Ally & Gargano, Carl Ally, Amil Gargano & Partners, Alabama Power, Audiovox, Burger King, Calvin Klein, Dunkin' Donuts, Federal Express, Fiat, Hertz, Horn & Hardart, IBM, Pentax, Piper Aircraft, Saab, SAS, Shearson Lehman, Sight Savers, Smithsonian Institution National Museum of American History, Syracuse University and Volvo. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.
